summary: This is a June 25, 2020 email from attorney Christopher Kroblin to a Special Agent, transmitting documents produced by the Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate in response to grand jury subpoenas. It explains the scope of production and notes that the 1953 Trust has no assets or accounts.

persons.context: Author of the email, transmitting documents responsive to grand jury subpoenas on behalf of the Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The estate for which the Co-Executors are producing documents in response to grand jury subpoenas.

connections.description: Kroblin is acting as legal counsel for the Co-Executors of Epstein's estate, representing the estate's interests in responding to grand jury subpoenas.
Had a discussion on June 2, 2020 regarding the grand jury subpoenas served on Epstein's estate.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoenas Issued
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas (numbers 2020RO0037.007 and 2020R0O037-008) were issued to the Co-Executors of the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein.
personsInvolved: Co-Executors of Estate of Jeffery Epstein

events.title: Discussion with AUSA
events.description: A discussion occurred between the estate's representatives and AUSA Brooks regarding the grand jury subpoenas.

events.title: Document Production to Grand Jury
events.description: The Co-Executors of Epstein's estate, via attorney Chris Kroblin, produced documents (Bates DVI_GJ 000001-000102) in response to the grand jury subpoenas.

keyFacts: The Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate produced documents to a grand jury in response to subpoenas dated May 28, 2020.
The production was limited; documents were responsive only to items 1, 2, 3, 5, and 10 of the subpoenas.
The estate's only existing trust, the 1953 Trust, is described as a 'pour-over trust' with no accounts, assets, or liabilities, so no documents were produced for several subpoena items.
The document production was transmitted by attorney Christopher Kroblin of Kellerhals Ferguson Kroblin PLLC, who was acting as counsel to the Co-Executors.
